thread.title: Kings trade Cousins in NBA blockbuster
thread.title_full: Kings trade Cousins in NBA blockbuster

title: Kings trade Cousins in NBA blockbuster
text:
Sacramento Kings trade DeMarcus Cousins to New Orleans Pelicans in blockbuster deal - reports February 20, 2017 5:24pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS THE Sacramento Kings have traded star centre DeMarcus Cousins in a blockbuster deal with the New Orleans Pelicans. 
The Pelicans will receive Cousins, in exchange for Buddy Hield, Tyreke Evans, Langston Galloway, a 2017 first-round pick, and a 2017 second-round pick (via the Philadelphia 76ers), according to the Vertical’s Adrian Wojnarowski. 
The Kings will also send forward Omri Casspi to the Pelicans as part of the deal, according to The Vertical’s Shams Charania. Former Sacramento Kings centre DeMarcus Cousins. Source: AP 
The Kings were engaged in trade talks centred on Cousins earlier on Monday (AEDT), before pulling the trigger on a trade with the Pelicans after the All-Star Game, which the big-man was involved in. 
According to the report, the Kings were, at one point, engaged with the Los Angeles Lakers, but those talks broke down. 
This trade will pair two former University of Kentucky stars in Cousins and Anthony Davis, the latter recently crowned at the NBA All-Star Game MVP. 
Cousins is averaging 27.8 points and 10.6 rebounds per game, thus far this season. The 2016-17 campaign is his sixth in the NBA, after being drafted with the fifth overall pick in 2010. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
